intro: Dicyclophora, commonly known as the golden balm, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties. Its leaves are often used in traditional herbal remedies for their anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic effects. Dicyclophora thrives in humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
